title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 1117/83 of 6 May 1983 amending Regulations (EEC) No 368/77 and (EEC) No 443/77 as regards the conditions for the release of the processing security for skimmed-milk powder
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 1117/83
of 6 May 1983
amending Regulations (EEC) No 368/77 and (EEC) No 443/77 as regards the conditions for the release of the processing security for skimmed-milk powder
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body:
The following paragraph is hereby added to Article 17 of Regulation (EEC) No 368/77:
'3. In the event of failure to comply with the undertakings referred to in Article 6, the processing security shall be forfeited. However, where a variation is established:
- of less than 2 % in relative value in the minimum crude fibre, starch and iron and copper salt content referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 of the Annex,
- of less than 3 % in relative value in the particle size composition of the denaturing agents referred to in paragraph 3 of the Annex,
the security shall nevertheless be released.
Member States shall notify the Commission each month of cases in which the provisions contained in the first subparagraph have been applied.'

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
